meme.title: Let’s make a meme
meme.intro: A “meme” is something that’s shared on the internet, and it usually has three parts: a picture, a caption, and a dash of humor. In this activity, you’ll make your own meme using a bit of HTML and your own creativity. Thimble, Mozilla’s code editor, makes it easy.
meme.step1: Click the “remix” button. This will open Thimble. You’ll see a simple meme we created to get you started.
meme.step2: Follow the steps in the tutorial. The tutorial will walk you through how to make changes to the code.
meme.step3: Done! Once you’re finished, you can save your work and share it. Log in to Webmaker and hit “Save.”
more: Try the next Made with Code activity. Use your new HTML and CSS skills to Make a Movie poster.
Or Webmaker has lots of other free activities too.

firstwebpage.title: Make your first web page
firstwebpage.intro:
You’ve probably seen hundreds (if not thousands) of web pages. All of them are written in a language called HTML.

It’s easy to start messing around with HTML. In this activity, you’ll make a basic web page in about 60 seconds or less, using Thimble, Mozilla’s free HTML power tool.
firstwebpage.step1: Click the “remix” button. This will open Thimble. You’ll see a simple web page we created to get you started. The code is on one side, the page preview is on the other.
firstwebpage.step2: Follow the steps. The tutorial will walk you through how to make changes to the code.
firstwebpage.step3: Done! Once you’re finished, you can save your work and share it. Log in to Webmaker and hit “Save.”

poster.title: Make a movie poster
poster.intro: Seen a movie or read any good books lately? Make a web page with your glowing (or vicious) review. Learn a little code along the way.
poster.step1: Click the “remix” button. This will open Thimble. You’ll see a placeholder movie poster to help you get started.
poster.step2: Follow the steps. The tutorial will walk you through how to swap in your own text, images and style.
poster.step3: Done! Once you’re finished, just log in to Webmaker and hit “Save”.
more: Try the next Made with Code activity. Use your new HTML and CSS skills to make your first web page.
Webmaker has lots of other free activities like this one.
